content.user_title: Web Artifacts Builder - Create React Artifacts for Claude
content.value_statement: Build sophisticated, interactive web artifacts for claude.ai using React, TypeScript, and shadcn/ui, then bundle them into a single shareable HTML file.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + TypeScript + Vite projects with shadcn/ui pre-configured
Auto-detect Node.js version and configure compatible dependencies
Include 40+ pre-installed shadcn/ui components (buttons, dialogs, forms, tables, etc.)
Configure Tailwind CSS with shadcn theming system and CSS variables
Set up path aliases (@/) for clean imports
Bundle entire React applications into single self-contained HTML files
Inline all JavaScript, CSS, and dependencies into artifact-ready output
Support path aliases during bundling with parcel-resolver-tspaths
Compatible with Node.js 18+ (auto-pins Vite version for compatibility)
limitations: Only for complex artifacts - not suitable for simple single-file HTML/JSX
Requires Node.js 18 or higher to run
Requires pnpm package manager (auto-installs if missing)
Project must have index.html in root directory for bundling
Bundled artifacts may be large due to inlined dependencies
No server-side rendering or backend functionality

Generates bundle.html (e.g., 850KB) containing entire React app as single self-contained HTML file ready for claude.ai artifacts

best_practices: Use this skill only for complex artifacts that truly need React and component libraries
Avoid 'AI slop' design: no excessive centered layouts, purple gradients, or uniform rounded corners
Import components using path aliases: import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
Test bundled artifacts after creation to ensure all functionality works
Keep artifact complexity reasonable to maintain manageable bundle sizes
Use shadcn/ui theming system with CSS variables for consistent styling
Present bundled artifacts to users immediately; defer optional testing unless requested
anti_patterns: Using this skill for simple single-component HTML artifacts (use basic HTML/JSX instead)
Creating artifacts without bundling them (defeats the purpose of single-file artifacts)
Ignoring Node.js version compatibility (script auto-handles this)
Testing artifacts before presenting them to users (adds unnecessary latency)
Using default Vite templates without customization (missing shadcn/ui setup)
Overusing centered layouts, purple gradients, and Inter font (creates generic 'AI slop' appearance)

faq.question: What's the difference between this and simple HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: Use web-artifacts-builder for complex applications requiring React state management, routing, multiple components, or shadcn/ui. Use simple HTML/JSX for single-component artifacts.

faq.question: Why does the bundle file size seem large?
faq.answer: The bundle includes React, all dependencies, CSS, and JavaScript inlined into a single HTML file. This is expected for self-contained artifacts.

faq.question: Can I use this with Node.js 16?
faq.answer: No, Node.js 18+ is required. The script auto-detects your version and configures compatible Vite versions for Node 18 vs 20+.

faq.question: What shadcn/ui components are included?
faq.answer: 40+ components including accordion, alert, avatar, badge, button, calendar, card, carousel, checkbox, dialog, dropdown, form, input, label, select, sheet, table, tabs, toast, tooltip, and many more.

faq.question: Do I need to install shadcn/ui components manually?
faq.answer: No, the init script pre-installs all 40+ shadcn/ui components and their Radix UI dependencies automatically.

faq.question: Can bundled artifacts run offline?
faq.answer: Yes, bundle.html is completely self-contained with no external dependencies, so it works offline and as a claude.ai artifact.

faq.question: Should I test artifacts before sharing them?
faq.answer: Testing is optional. Present the artifact to users first to minimize latency, then test later if issues arise or if requested.

permissions: File system read/write access for project creation
Network access to install npm packages
